weather_report:
Good morning, Evanston. As the sun rises over the horizon, temperatures sit in the low teens, giving a crisp and cool feel to the air. The wind is a howling presence, invigorating some and biting others with gusts that sweep around at over 30 miles per hour. The sky is clear, providing a serene view across Lake Michigan, where the water dances gently with modest waves, perfect for those who find peace in nature's rhythm. 

As we progress through the day, expect the sun to shine brightly, pushing temperatures up into the lower 20s. Though a warming trend is on the horizon, wind chill will temper that comfort, making it feel far chillier, especially in the gusts later. Tonight, things will cool down further, settling in around the teen mark under mostly cloudy skies. With no precipitation in sight, it’s an excellent day to bundle up and perhaps take a brisk walk along the lake or engage in graceful winter sports, maximizing the beauty of the season. For those heading outside, be sure to layer up—keeping warm will be essential as we embrace the season's chill in this part of the world.
